step.context: \text{Intuitively, where all could f(x) - as defined }\\ \text{above - be discontinuous?}
step.reason: \text{For }x\lt 2, f(x)\text{ is a cubic polynomial.}\\ \text{For }x\gt 2, f(x)\text{ is a parabola.}\\ \text{Either way, f(x) is continuous for those x.}\\ \text{The only problem point could be }x=2\text{ where}\\ \text{the two curves meet - or don't meet.}

\textbf{Be careful }\text{about which f(x) to use}\\ \text{for which x. Remember, }f(x) = x^2 + 1, x \geq 2.\\ \text{Moreover, for a function to be continuous}\\ \textbf{two conditions}\text{ must be satisfied}\\ \begin{tabular}{l|c} \hline \text{In English} & \text{Mathematically} \\ \hline \text{The function must approach} & \\ \text{the same value from the left } & \\ \text{and the right} & \lim_{x\to a}f(x)\text{ exists.}\\ \text{And that value should be} & \\ \text{equal to the value of the} & \\ \text{function at that point} & \lim_{x\to a}f(x) = f(a) \\ \hline \end{tabular}\\ \text{This also means that wherever a function is}\\ \text{continuous, it can be drawn without lifting}\\ \text{the pencil.}
